controller.editor

Interface GridEditor

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    PatternEditor
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    GridEditorImpl

    public interface GridEditor
    This interface represents a simple editor for a grid of Conway's Game of Life.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void changeSizes(int horizontal, int vertical)
      Resizes the status grid to the given dimensions.
      void clean()
      Resets the status grid to its initial state.
      void draw(Generation gen)
      Displays the given generation on the grid.
      Generation getGeneration()
      Returns the first generation of the computation.
      void hit(int row, int column)
      Applies a Status change in the given position.
      boolean isEnabled()
      Returns true if the editor allows editing operations.
      void setEnabled(java.lang.Boolean enabled)
      Set true if the editor is able to operate modifications on the grid.

    • Method Detail

      • draw

        Displays the given generation on the grid.
        Parameters:
        gen - the Generation

        void hit(int row,
         int column)
        Applies a Status change in the given position.
        Parameters:
        row - the row
        column - the column
        Throws:
        IllegalSateException - if not in placing mode

      • getGeneration

        Generation getGeneration()
        Returns the first generation of the computation.
        Returns:

        Set true if the editor is able to operate modifications on the grid.
        Parameters:
        enabled - true if the editor allows editing operations

        Returns true if the editor allows editing operations.
        Returns:

      • clean

        Resets the status grid to its initial state.

      • changeSizes

        void changeSizes(int horizontal,
                 int vertical)
        Resizes the status grid to the given dimensions.
        Parameters:
        horizontal - the number of columns
        vertical - the number of rows
